metro

Class GameState

  • java.lang.Object
    • metro.GameState

  • public class GameState
extends java.lang.Object
    A game state is the place where all game relevant information are stored. There can only be one instance of the game state accessible by instance(). This class uses the singleton pattern to be sure that there's only be one instance at all.
    Author:
    hauke

      • getInstance

        public static GameState getInstance()
        Returns:
        The instance of the game state. There can only be one instance per game.

      • getMoney

        public int getMoney()
        Gets the money of the player.
        Returns:
        The players money.

      • addMoney

        public boolean addMoney(int moreMoney)
        Add an specific amount of money to the players account. Giving a negative amount will subtract money from the account.
        Parameters:
        moreMoney - The money to add/subtract.
        Returns:
        True when transaction was successful, false when not (e.g. not enough money).

      • getStations

        public java.util.ArrayList<TrainStation> getStations()
        Returns:
        A list of all train stations.

      • getBaseNetSpacing

        public int getBaseNetSpacing()
        Returns:
        Gets the size of the base net spacing.
